sub_title: Communications Advisor Orange Corners bij Rijksdienst voor Ondernemend Nederland/Netherlands Enterprise Agency - Netherlands Ministry of Economic Affairs
summary:
I am a historian and Middle East analyst who is passionate about bygone ages and empires. Although I specialized in the First World War my world did not stop moving in 1918. Topics as the position of minorities in the contemporary Middle East or religious politics in Saudi Arabia and Iran interest me just as much as the Ottoman millet system or pan-Islamist politics. For this reason I did internships at the Netherlands Embassy in Kuwait and the Egyptian Organization for Human Rights in Cairo, Egypt. 

During my studies, I never focused on one country. I did two semesters abroad and two internships in four completely different countries, and my research spans Europe, Turkey, the Arabic World, Iran, and the Indian subcontinent. As a modern nomad I feel as comfortable in the poor traditional south of Tunisia as I do in cosmopolitan Istanbul or conservative Kuwait. My volunteering activities are just as diverse: I am a writer and editor for different magazines, I organize activities for expats, and am involved with my local community center. 

After graduating, I spent 4.5 years in northern Germany’s main metropole, Hamburg. I originally came for a six-month traineeship, ended up staying a little longer as I absolutely loved start-up life. In addition to currywurst and franzbrötchen, in Hamburg I developed a fondness for statistics, infographics, contemporary trends, and new media. 

Currently, I work as Marketing & Communications Advisor Orange Corners at the Netherlands Enterprise Agency, an executive agency of the Netherlands Ministry of Economic Affairs and Climate Change (EZK). Here I have the opportunity to contribute a little to building entrepreneurial ecosystems in Asia, Africa and the Middle East. As I preferably work for organizations that are concerned with improving the world around them, my current job is pretty close to being my dream job.

projects.title: Wiki Loves Monuments
projects.description:
Wiki Loves Monuments is a Dutch initiative, that since the first edition in 2010 has developed into an international photo contest held in over 40 countries each year. WLM was twice acknowledged as the largest photo contest in the world (2012 and 2013). The number of entries in 2013 was around 370,000 worldwide.

The goal of WLM is to collect as many high-quality photos of monuments as possible, to create an overview of national heritage around the world on Wikipedia.

profile_positions.description:
In charge of overall marketing and communications for the Orange Corners programme.

* Support the 19 local OC hubs with their branding, marketing and communications
* External OC communications: newsletters
* Internal OC communications: BZ, EZK and RVO channels, Smarp, Intranet, newsletters
* Website development and management
* Social media management (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn)
* OC Toolkit management
* Monitoring & effect
* Purchasing goods and services
* Internship supervisor for communications and graphic design interns

Trainings:
* Corporate Social Responsibility

Orange Corners contributes to building entrepreneurial ecosystems for youth in Africa, Asia and the Middle East. Orange Corners is active in Algeria, Angola, Bangladesh, Côte d'Ivoire, Egypt (Cairo & Upper Egypt), Ghana, Iraq (Baghdad & Erbil), Jordan, Morocco, Mozambique, Nigeria, the Palestinian Territories, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Senegal, South Africa and Sudan.
profile_positions.title: Marketing and Communications Advisor Orange Corners

profile_positions.description:
Content Expert for the NL Branding team, with a focus on sustainability and international cooperation in the fields agro-food, horticulture & startups. Previously also peace, justice & security, ICT/AI, climate & creative industries. Contributing to the positioning of the Netherlands abroad, under the umbrella slogan 'solving global challenges together'. 

* Producing content for the NL Platform & NL Toolkit (English)
* Developing key messages, slogans & other content for incoming and outgoing international missions, international trade fairs, Partners in International Business & Private Sector Development clusters and large events such as Expo 2020 Dubai, Floriade 2022 (English)
* Producing narratives, flyers, brochures, PowerPoint presentations, slideshows, etc for top sectors and public diplomacy themes (Dutch & English)
* Website management
* NL Toolkit management
* Monitoring & effect
* Social media management (Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn - English)
* RVO internal communication (Smarp, Intranet - Dutch & English)
* Represent NL Branding on RVO employee board
* Proofreading and editing (Dutch & English)
* Translation (English-Dutch & Dutch-English)
* Buddy for new content colleagues

Tools:
* Zoom/Webex/Microsoft Teams
* Twitter/LinkedIn/Instagram
* Coosto
* Matomo
* Spotler
* Smarp
* InDesign
* Photoshop
* Illustrator

Trainings & workshops:
* Lean management
* Effective writing
* Workplace communication
* SEO
* Insights Discovery
* Brand voice
* Spotler email marketing
* Creative DTP Summer School - InDesign, Photoshop & Illustrator

The Netherlands Enterprise Agency (Rijksdienst voor Ondernemend Nederland, RVO) is an executive body of the Dutch Ministry of Economic Affairs and Climate Policy. It helps business owners run sustainable, agricultural, innovative or international businesses. The Netherlands Enterprise Agency also helps them arrange grants, find business partners, access the right expertise, and comply with legislation and regulations.
profile_positions.title: Content Expert NL Branding
Senior Researcher, Translator & Content Manager Benelux

profile_positions.description:
Market research & content management. Research areas: Society, FMCG (Food & Non-Food), Retail & Trade and Media & Advertising in the Netherlands, Belgium and Luxembourg.

* Research regarding market trends in the Benelux countries. 
* Keeping up to date with research done on and in the Benelux countries.
* Creating and translating statistics.
* Compiling and writing market reports and topic pages on the Benelux and Europe level.
* Answering customer requests related to the Benelux area, assisting with requests about other countries and the EU region.
* Content management of the Benelux statistics database.
* Translation Dutch-English, English-Dutch and occasionally also German-Dutch and French-English.
* Proofreading and editing the work of colleagues working on topics as finance, sports and hospitality.
* Project management: internal communication, task management for students, writing extended webtexts for researchers, KPI and goals project group, work shadow buddy.
* HR contact for the Benelux team, interviewing potential new colleagues and student employees.
* Training of new colleagues in the Benelux team. 
* Supervision of student employees/freelancers working for the Benelux and EU team.
* Producing weekly infographics about current topics aimed at the Benelux market (Dutch and English), in cooperation with the graphics department. 
* Identifying potential data cooperation partners, in cooperation with Business Development.

Trainings followed:
* Deep web search
* Key business figures
* HR best practices
* Train the trainer
* Excel (bronze and silver)
* PowerPoint

Statista is the company behind www.statista.com, one of the world’s leading statistics portals. Customers such as Google and Bloomberg trust Statista's high-quality market research, data intelligence, and content marketing services. Statista has been awarded multiple-times as a leading innovative and digital company.
profile_positions.title: Junior Researcher, Translator & Content Manager Benelux

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the Dutch-speaking market. Tasks included content management of the Dutch-English and English-Dutch dictionaries, translating from English to Dutch, linkbuilding, promoting bab.la on the Dutch-speaking market, designing language learning materials (grammar lessons and vocabulary lessons in Dutch and English), writing blog articles about language and culture, managing Lexiophiles (the bab.la blog) and managing IX16 (the bab.la travel blog competition).

bab.la is all about languages. The bab.la language portal offers free bilingual dictionaries, language quizzes, language games, vocabulary lessons, professional translations and much more. Users are encouraged to participate by creating own quizzes, submitting new translations, writing comments and rating content. bab.la is currently available in 28 languages.
profile_positions.title: Content and Digital Marketing Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the organization of the Dutch version of Wiki Loves Monuments, the largest photo contest in the world. Tasks included communication/PR (social media, writing press releases and articles for the website), website management, the organization of events (Wiki Takes Dudok, Hilversum) and fundraising.

Wikimedia Netherland is part of the global Wikimedia movement and provides the Netherlands with an environment where volunteers and organizations work together to gather and disseminate free knowledge. Wikimedia Nederland encourages people and organizations to apply free licenses and contribute to the Wikimedia projects. We inform the public about the concept of free knowledge, Wikipedia and other Wikimedia projects, and about the Wikimedia movement. Wikimedia Netherland assumes that free knowledge and free licenses can be successfully applied and are a valuable contribution to society. The free encyclopedia Wikipedia then takes a central place.
